thread.title: Only Fools and Horses secret reunion episode was LOST after tragic death of scriptwriter
thread.title_full: Only Fools and Horses secret reunion episode was LOST after tragic death of scriptwriter

author: mirror
title: Only Fools and Horses secret reunion episode was LOST after tragic death of scriptwriter
text:
TV Only Fools and Horses secret reunion episode was LOST after tragic death of scriptwriter Actor John Challis, who played Boycie in the long-running show, said writer John Sullivan never got to finis his script Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Trailer for the last ever episode of Only Fools and Horses Share this video Get soaps     
It is one of the most beloved British comedies in television history. 
So fans of Only Fools and Horses will no doubt be disappointed to learn that they were denied a final reunion episode - after TV bosses failed to complete it. 
Actor John Challis, who played Boycie in the long-running show, has revealed that plans were afoot for a 2011 get-together starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst, but it collapsed when scriptwriter John Sullivan sadly died of viral pneumonia, that year. He was just 64. 
“Just before John died he was actually getting together a special for us,” 74-year-old Challis told the Daily Star. “It was going to be Del Boy’s 65th birthday – for which everyone would meet at The Nag’s Head – and retirement. John Challis as Boycie and David Jason as Delboy Trotter (Photo: BBC) David pictured with Nicholas Lyndhurst as Rodney (Photo: BBC) 
Arthur Daley's camel hair coat sells for hefty amount after actor George Cole's widow flogs it at auction 
"Everyone was going to be part of that, but unfortunately John got ill and never recovered, so it never happened.” 
It would have aired as part of the show’s 30th anniversary celebrations and surely would've been a smash-hit. 
More than 24 million people tuned in for a special Christmas episode broadcast on December 29 1996, in which David Jason's Del Boy finally got rich after auctioning an antique watch. 
It remains the biggest audience ever recorded for a single transmission of a TV programme in the UK, according to figures compiled by the Press Association. John is still best-known for his role in the BBC comedy (Photo: Roland Leon/Daily Mirror) 
Artist meets David Jason by chance on same day he completes painting of Only Fools and Horses star 
A total of four episodes of Only Fools And Horses appear in the top 20 most-watched shows, along with favourites such as Morecambe And Wise, Coronation Street and the Royal Variety Performance. 
Earlier this year the show's lead actor, David Jason, said he’d do another Only Fools And Horses – but only if they found the right writer. 
The telly legend said: “That would be good, wouldn’t it? We haven’t got a writer, if we had a good writer like the lovely John Sullivan, we would, I tell you. But my partner Nick (Lyndhurst) has gone on to other things, so you are stuck with Open All Hours.” 
Last year the BBC remade a string of old classics including Porridge and Are You Being Served? Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
